definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Some languages, including Latin, have a flexible word order.
sentences.chinese: 一些語言，包括拉丁文，都有靈活的詞序變化。

sentences.english: End focus and end weight are two important principles to determine the word order.
sentences.chinese: 末尾焦點和末尾加重是決定英語詞序的兩條重要原則。

sentences.english: When you report a question, any question, you do not use question word order.
sentences.chinese: 在轉化問句的時候，我們不會用原問句的詞序。

sentences.english: Word order in questions is less difficult to master in informal spoken French.
sentences.chinese: 問句中的詞序在非正式法語口語中沒那麼難把握。

sentences.english: Perhaps the commonest cause of ambiguity is careless word order.
sentences.chinese: 也許歧義的最普通的原因是由於粗心導致的詞序。

definition: my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
mulberry farming/to grow mulberry for sericulture
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
